definition[0]: an action or event that is a signal for something else to happen
example[0]: Our success was the cue for other companies to press ahead with new investment.
example[1]: I think that’s my cue to explain why I’m here.
definition[1]: a word, phrase, or action in a play that is a signal for the next person to speak or act
note[2]: miss your cue (=not speak or act when you are supposed to)
example[2]: She stood nervously in the wings waiting for her cue.
definition[2]: a long straight wooden stick used for hitting the ball in games such as billiards and pool
definition[3]: to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance
example[3]: The studio manager will cue you when it’s your turn to come on.
